result.execSummary:
The defendant Darwin M Copley was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Hit and Run-Involve Injury, an unclassified felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.67(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

(SF) Cases 15CF261, 15CM457 and 16CF51 called at 2:54 pm
Defendant Darwin M Copley not in court. ADA Monica J. Hall appeared for the State of Wisconsin along with Agent Paul Hasenstab who appears for the Department of Corrections.


Court reviews that there was a hearing set based on the 8/21/19 letter from DOC.
ADA Hall informs the Court that there is victim rights compliance.
Agent Hasenstab informs the Court that he wrote the letter when he was preparing the DOC-2678 Certificate of Discharge and Satisfaction of Probation Conditions for Expungement form.

Court presents basis and denies the expungement.

recess: 3:02 pm
Hearing on September 9, 2019 at 02:30 pm.

records.addlTxt:
[MK] cases #15CF261, #15CM457, #16CF51 called briefly at 9:33am and then at 9:55am 
Defendant Darwin M Copley in court with Attorney Jeffrey J De La Rosa.  ADA Theresa Beck appears for the State of Wisconsin.
The Court addresses the restitution issue as to Case #15CF261 only:  
--ADA Beck submits State's Exhibit #1;  a packet of restitution related materials. 
--arguments are given by counsel on the contested value of the Moped replacement.  
--the victim, Steven Adams, makes a statement 
The Court fixes the value of the Moped to be $700; this amount will be paid as restitution to the victim as a condition of Probation.

ADA Beck recites the stipulation of the parties that the other amounts due for restitution are: 
$100 collision deductible amount 
$100 medical deductible amount
$758.33 in medical co-pay amounts
$2,280.52 for eighty hours of sick-time used 
 
On agreement of counsel, the $700 amount for the Moped is divided out to be $453.88 payable to American Family Insurance, and $246.12 to Mr. Adams.  
The Court adopts these stipulated amounts and the stipulated division of the Moped-amount as its Order. 
The Court finds that Mr. Copley is financially able to pay these restitution amounts. 
recess 10:06m.  

NEXT:  amend the JOC in Case #15CF261 to include as conditions of Probation:  to pay restitution of $453.88 to American Family Insurance, to pay restitution of $3,484.97 to Steven Adams [the restitution processing fee amount is to be set accordingly]
Restitution hearing on November 22, 2016 at 09:30 am.
with attached victim restitution request form(s)
Criminal Case Settlement
with elements

Cases 15CF261,15CM457,16CF51 called together at 10:20am [ma]
Defendant Darwin M Copley in court with attorney Jeffrey Jacob De La Rosa.  Monica J. Hall appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  

Maximum penalties recited; Constitutional rights reviewed; plea of " NO CONTEST " entered on Case 15CF261, 15CM457, Count #1, and Case 16CF51, Count #3; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified; the Court accepts the plea, finds Defendant guilty, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.

On Motion of the State, the Court reads-in and dismisses Counts #2 and #3 of 15CM457 and Counts #1 and #2 of Case 16CF51

Sentencing arguments given by Counsel
Statement made by Mr. Copley

On Case 15CF261: the Court withholds sentence, and places Defendant on Probation for 2 years.
On Count #1 of Case 15CM457, the Court withholds sentence, and places Defendant on Probation for 2 years.
On Count #3 of Case 16CF51, the Court withholds sentence, and places Defendant on Probation for 2 years.


Conditions of Probation: 
--As to Case 16CF51, Count #3: to serve 10 days in the Jefferson County Jail, with work-release privileges, to commence on     10/7/16 at 6:00pm.
---Mr Copley is required to report for commencement and service of jail sentence with absolute sobriety and without non-prescribed controlled substances in system; non-compliance will result in loss of work-release privileges without further process.

--to undergo AODA assessment and follow through with recommended treatment per Agent
--absolute sobriety (no possession or consumption of alcohol or illegal drugs, take all prescription drugs as prescribed)
--random drug/ alcohol screens
--to undergo any other assessment, treatment, or counseling as deemed appropriate by the Agent
--to obtain/maintain employment and/or education program as approved by the Agent
--to pay statutory costs
--to pay restitution in an amount to be determined at restitution hearing
--submit DNA sample


Days credit for time already served:  0 days
The Court grants Mr. Copley expungement upon successful completion of Probation 
recess:10:55am

NEXT: JA please schedule Restitution Hearing out 45 days, allow one hour.
Plea/sentencing hearing on September 26, 2016 at 10:00 am.

Reserve Judge Nettesheim presiding for Branch 4
Cases 15CF261 & 16CF51 called at 2:09pm
Defendant Darwin M Copley in court with attorney Jeffrey Jacob De La Rosa.  ADA Jeffrey Martin Shock appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Attorney De La Rosa request that a change of plea and sentencing hearing be scheduled. within the next few weeks. 
Attorney De La Rosa indicates that Mr. Copley has 2 seperate Branch 3 cases, however Attorney De La Rosa has checked with Judge Wambach and Branch 3 has no objections to this Branch hearing those 2 cases along with the Branch 4 cases. 
ADA Shock indicates the State has no objections. 

Bail stands as fixed including any and all conditions previously set. 



Recess: 2:11pm

(off record the clerk reviews pending cases for Mr. Copley and locates a single pending Branch 3 case - 15CM457)

Cases 15CF261 & 16CF51 called together at 10:32 am [Clerk SH]
Defendant Darwin M Copley in court with Attorney Jeffrey Jacob De La Rosa. ADA Monica J. Hall appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

BOTH CASES:
Service of Information admitted; reading waived; maximum penalties recited.
Pleas of "not guilty" entered
Atty De La Rosa requests that both cases be set for STC in 30 - 45 days, do believe may have resolution at that time
ADA Hall, no objection as to scheduling. For the record notes that the victim for case 15CF261 is present
Court reminds Defendant that bond and conditions of bond remain in effect as case is pending.
Atty De La Rosa informs the Court that there is another misdemeanor file, that is currently assigned to BrIII. Inquires if that a global resolution can reached, if this Court would be willing to hear all matters.
Court informs parties that It will hear all matters as long as assigned Judge approves.
Recess: 10:35 am

cases #15CF261, #15CM457, #16CF51 called at 1: 37 pm. 
Defendant Darwin M Copley appears via videoconferencing from the Jefferson County Jail, in custody, with Attorney Jeffrey De La Rosa (PD will appoint counsel on the new case, #16CF51).  ADA Brookellen Teuber appears for the State of Wisconsin.  
On agreement of counsel, the Court finds that the videoconferencing system is sight and sound sufficient. 

Initial Appearance held as to Case #16CF51:
--Service of Criminal Complaint admitted; reading is waived; the charges and maximum penalties are recited.  
--Preliminary Hearing time limits are waived by both parties. 

The Court requires a $350 Cash Bond which applies to all three cases, with conditions as previously ordered in Cases #15CF261 and #15CM457, with an added condition of:  no possession of any drug paraphernali unless in possession of a prescription. 
recess 1:45pm.
